data.title: Ghost Sonata (August Strindberg / Theatre Works)
data.meta_description:
Ghost Sonata (August Strindberg / Theatre Works) by Kostis Vozikis, released 12 December 2012

1. Everything is haunted in this town
2. The wheel
3. Walk with me
4. The corporal
5. Force
6. The daughter
7. Oh, the bells
8. Dead man walking
9. Be a good dog Mr. Johansson
10. Dancing bones
11. Everything is static, since that day
12. Alone at last
13. Noone can hear you scream
14. Salvation
15. Thin air
16. Who could possibly stand this loss?
17. Rebirth

Original music score for the theatrical play "Ghost Sonata".
Composed and performed by K., Viola performed by Dimitra Kationi
Instruments used: El. guitar, el. bass, ac. guitar, viola, musical saw, daouli, bells, ashtrays, chains, samples.

The Ghost Sonata (Sp√∂ksonaten) is a play in three acts by Swedish playwright August Strindberg. It is a key text in the development of modernist drama and a vivid example of a chamber play. In it, Strindberg creates a world in which ghosts walk in bright daylight, a beautiful woman is transformed into a mummy and lives in the closet, and the household cook sucks all the nourishment out of the food before she serves it to her masters.

The Ghost Sonata relates the adventures of a young student, who idealizes the lives of the inhabitants of a stylish apartment building in Stockholm. He makes the acquaintance of the mysterious Jacob Hummel, who helps him to find his way into the apartment, only to find that it is a nest of betrayal and sickness. The world, the student learns, is hell and human beings must suffer to achieve salvation. The play centers on a family of strangers who meet for the sake of meeting. They exchange no dialogue, nor gestures, they simply sit and bask in their own misfortune.
